snippet: Broad search powers at the border are being challenged as more people travel with personal and business information on devices that would typically require a warrant to examine.
abstract: Broad government search powers at the border are being challenged by several court cases as more people travel with personal and business information on devices that would typically require a warrant to examine; cases seek to limit ability of Customs and Border Protection agents to search and seize devices without suspicion of illegal activity.
lead_paragraph: Broad search powers at the border are being challenged as more people travel with personal and business information on devices that would typically require a warrant to examine.

headline.seo: Court Cases Challenge Border Searches of Laptops and Phones
headline.main: Border Agents’ Power to Search Devices Is Facing Increasing Challenges in Court
headline.print_headline: Border Agents’ Power to Search Devices Is Facing Increasing Challenges in Court
